e4: Adopting the new policy eliminates bias in reported earnings, fostering transparency and aligning with ethical business practices. It reduces legal risk by adhering to honest reporting standards. Although some investors may initially misinterpret the change, clear communication can adjust expectations, ultimately benefiting the company’s long-term integrity and investor trust.
e5: An ethical reporting policy ensures transparency, accuracy, and consistency, reflecting true financial performance without manipulation. It prioritizes integrity, compliance with regulations, and fair treatment of all investors, preventing information asymmetry. An ethical approach also involves clear communication of any changes to maintain investor confidence and understanding of financial metrics.
e6: Yes, I would ask how the management plans to communicate the policy change to investors to ensure clarity and understanding. Additionally, what strategies are in place to manage potential short-term market reactions and the impact on retail versus institutional investors?
